meanings.definition: To move from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: I will amove the chair to the other side of the room.
meanings.sent2: She likes to amove quickly when playing tag.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to amove from the couch to the windowsill.
meanings.sent4: The wind can amove the leaves in the garden.
meanings.sent5: Please remember to amove your car from the driveway before the street sweeper comes.

meanings.sent1: The loud music amoves the crowd at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The surprise party really amoved her.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks amove the audience with wonder.
meanings.sent4: Her speech amoved everyone to take action.
meanings.sent5: The thrilling movie amoved the viewers with suspense.

meanings.definition: To cause to change position or direction.
meanings.sent1: The strong gust of wind amoved the umbrella from its place.
meanings.sent2: The new road signs amove traffic in a different direction.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news amoved his plans for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: The coach's strategy amoved the team towards victory.
meanings.sent5: The magnetic force amoved the needle on the compass.
